Detailed Description

Represents a persistant list of SIP service provider accounts.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AccountList::AccountList ( const PString &  filename  ) 

Loads a new AccountList from a file.

If the file does not exist, the AccountList will be empty.

AccountList::~AccountList (  )  [virtual]

Deallocates all internal memory plus all Account objects.

Note that deleting this object will render pointers returned by GetAccount() unusable, since that heap memory will be deallocated.

Member Function Documentation

void AccountList::AddAccount ( Account *  account  ) 

Add a new account to this list.

Note that it is an error to add the same Account (the same heap memory space) to multiple AccountList objects. This AccountList will assume responsibility for managing the memory associated with the passed Account. It is an error for the caller to subsequently delete the heap memory allocated to the pointer passed into this method.

Account * AccountList::GetAccount ( int  index = 0  ) 

Returns a pointer to an account in the list of accounts, or NULL if no such account exists.

This class retains responsibility for memory management. Deleting the returned pointer is an error. However, modification of the Account is allowed and expected as the means of editing contents of the list in place.

Parameters:
index optional; the array index of the account sought; zero is the default index.
Returns:
requested account or NULL if the index is out of range.

int AccountList::GetCount (  )  const

Returns the number of Accounts in the list.

void AccountList::RemoveAccount ( const Account *  account  ) 

Remove an account from the list.

Note that this Account's heap memory will be deallocated, and pointers to this account retrieved using GetAccount() and the pointer passed in via AddAccount(Account *) (when applicable) will be left dangling. Also note that the parameter must appear in this list and must be managed only by this AccountList.

bool AccountList::Save (  )  const

Saves the AccountList to the file provided in the constructor.

If that file does not exist, it will be created if possible.

Returns:
if successful

bool AccountList::SaveTo ( const PString &  filename  )  const

Saves the AccountList to a file whose name is provided by the caller.

If that file does not exist, it will be created if possible. Use to make a backup copy of the account config file.

Returns:
if successful

void AccountList::SetDefault ( const Account *  account  ) 

Moves an account to the first array index.

The parameter must exist in the list.
